text: hi there my name is Stephanie Chan I'm
an AWS worldwide go to market security
Specialists cyber security incidents
often stem from vulnerabilities that are
exploited by attackers allowing them to
escalate Privileges and move laterally
within the systems it's crucial for
organizations to continuously scan their
resources for vulnerabilities AWS offers
a vulnerability Management Service
called Amazon inspector and we'll be
diving deep on this service during this
video Amazon inspector is an automated
vulnerability Management Service that
continually assesses workloads including
Amazon ec2 instances containers and
Lambda functions for software
vulnerabilities and unintended Network
exposure in this video we'll be taking a
look at six popular features of Amazon
inspector first let's talk about Amazon
ec2 scanning Amazon inspector ec2
scanning extracts metadata from ec2
instances and compares the metadata
against rules collected from security
advisories inspector scans instances for
package vulnerabilities and network
reachability issues to produce findings
with agentless ec2 scanning you can
expand coverage across your
infrastructure for ec2 instances that do
not have SSM agents installed or
configured agentless ec2 scanning
continuously monitors Amazon ec2
instances for software vulnerabilities
by taking a snapshot of the EBS volume
to extract data about the system and
uses this to perform vulnerability
Assessments in your inspector dashboard
under general settings click on the ec2
scanning settings link here you can see
the scan mode in this example because I
am the delegated admin account I can
update this change for all accounts
within the organization with just one
click because inspector is a regional
service this configuration change only
affects the region that the delegated
admin account is logged into make sure
to apply this change to all applicable
regions the Lambda scanning feature
provides continuous automated
vulnerability assessments with two types
of Lambda function scanning including
standard and code Lambda standard
scanning checks for package
vulnerabilities in dependencies and
Associated layers and Lambda code
scanning checks for code vulnerabilities
in custom application code Amazon
inspector manages channels to monitor
your cloud trail events for these scans
allowing you to view the results looking
at the findings by Lambda function page
you can see the exact function where a
vulnerability is identified in the layer
there will be a tag for this layer and
you can also see which library or which
version it is fixed in the code scan
section will show you the impacted
versions and how to fix the version or
vulnerability
a lot of these details are available for
you to use and you can export all
findings to various formats next we'll
cover the es bomb export feature es
bombs or software bill of materials is a
list of all the open- source and
thirdparty components that make up
software inspectors sbom export feature
supports Cyclone DX and spdx formats for
all monitored resources you can export
es bombs for all resources or specific
ones supporting extensive analysis via
Athena and quick site a key
differentiator about Amazon on
inspectors that it generates s bombs for
both operating system packages and
third-party programming language
packages and it goes through transitive
dependencies once exported you can run
Athena queries or build quicksite
dashboards on the sbom if you take a
look at your inspector dashboard you can
click on the export esoms link on the
left hand side without a filter all
resources will be exported by default
but here you're able to add a filter for
a specific account a specific instance
or a combination of both under esom
export settings you can select if you
want Cyclone DX or spdx format with this
feature you're able to export as many
resources as possible with no additional
charge inspector's ECR image scanning
feature scans container images in Amazon
ECR for vulnerabilities inspector ECR
enhanced scanning continuously scans for
OS and language package vulnerabilities
at the registry level so that you are
aware as soon as a new vulnerability
occurs you can use inspector for
container image scanning within ECR and
within cicd pipelines such such as
Jenkins GitHub actions and On Demand
directly from developers local machines
with Amazon inspector cicd integration
inspector can detect security issues
much sooner in the development process
by assessing container images during
their build within cicd tools assessment
results are returned in your real time
directly to the cicd tools dashboard and
there's no need to enable Amazon
inspector to use this by integrating
container image scanning into the cicd
workflow development teams can
automatically analyze images for V
vulnerabilities and misconfigurations
before deployment this proactive
approach allows for the identification
of potential security risks early in the
development life cycle additionally
establishing policies to prevent
deploying images with critical
vulnerabilities ensures that only secure
container images make their way into
production contributing to a more
resilient and secure cicd pipeline the
ond demand CIS scans feature perform CIS
scans on target instances based on tags
and scanning schedule the scans check if
the instance configurations meet
specific CIS recommendations which are
identified by CIS check IDs and titles
the scan results detail which checks
passed skipped or failed for each
instance which allows you to identify
and remediate any security configuration
issues to operationalize Amazon
inspector you have multiple options
inspector findings can be integrated
with AWS security Hub and event bridge
to automate responses such as ticketing
system notifications and closure upon
remediation findings and Es bombs can
also be exported to S3 in CSV or Json
formats finally the inspector score in
Amazon inspector is a metric that
indicates the severity of
vulnerabilities and findings detected in
your Cloud environment this score takes
into account various factors like the
common vulnerability scoring system
score Network reachability and potential
impact a higher inspector score suggests
that the vulnerability should be
prioritized for
remediation and that wraps up our video
for today we covered how Amazon
inspector offers automated Discovery and
scanning of your workloads addressing
vulnerabilities and enhancing your
security posture for more details
contact your AWS account team or email
us at awsd detection
andreson amazon.com thank you for
watching
